III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was caught masturbating in class. There is concern the
youth is being touched by an unknown individual at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 4, 2024.
Complainant did not have any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Christ Child House,
on March 6, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth A said he moved to Christ Child House yesterday and had
previously been placed at Wolverine Center. Youth A said he had
his own room and felt safe while at Wolverine Center. Youth A
denied masturbating in class at school or talking to a counselor at
school. Youth A denied any youth at Wolverine Center or school
touching him sexually or teaching him how to masturbate.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
6, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said
he was placed on the same floor as Youth A. Youth B said all
youth have their own rooms and are not allowed in each other’s
bedrooms. Youth B had no knowledge of any youth going into
Youth A’s room. Youth B said staff are “always watching us”.
Youth B said he feels safe with the staff at Wolverine Center and
with “some” of the youth, stating some youth try to fight with him
which makes him feel unsafe, but staff always are present and
stop youth from hurting him. Youth B denied anyone being
inappropriate with him or Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
6, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said
all of the staff at Wolverine are “good” and denied anyone being
inappropriate with him. Youth C said his room was on the same
floor at Youth A. Youth C said Youth A would try to hit him and
2

cuss at him and staff would intervene and separate them. Youth C
said all youth have their own rooms and they are not allowed in
each other’s bedrooms. Youth C denied ever going into Youth A’s
room or seeing any other youth in Youth A’s room. Youth C said
youth have to go into the bathroom one at a time and are never
allowed to be in the bathroom together. Youth C said he has never
seen more than one youth in the bathroom and denied going into
the bathroom with any other youth.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
March 6, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist said he was informed by Case Manager that the school
reported Youth A had been caught masturbating in class on March
1, 2024. Therapist said he met with Youth A when he returned
from school that day and Youth A denied ever being sexually
touched or taught to masturbate by any youth or staff at Wolverine
Center. Therapist said Youth A has been sexually abused in his
past and would masturbate almost daily at the facility either in his
room or the bathroom. Therapist said Youth A had impulse issues
and would often follow other youth’s behaviors or actions.
Therapist said he has never heard or seen any staff or youth
acting sexually inappropriate towards Youth A.
Case Manager was interviewed via telephone on March 6,
2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Case Manager
said she received a phone call from Youth A’s school counselor
on March 1, 2024, and was told that Youth A was masturbating in
the classroom. Case Manager said the school counselor told her
that Youth A reported he masturbates at Wolverine Center with
other youth. Case Manager said she told Therapist about the
information from the school and Therapist met with Youth A to
discuss the incident. Case Manager said she is not aware of
Youth A masturbating at Wolverine Center. Case Manager said
she has no knowledge of Youth A being sexually touched by
anyone at Wolverine Center.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
6, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Director said
she has no knowledge of Youth A masturbating at the facility in
front of other youth or staff. Director had no knowledge of Youth A
being sexually touched by another youth or staff while at
Wolverine Center. Director said the facility was contacted due to
Youth A wanting to take his pants off on the bus and when asked
Youth A said he was “hot”. Director said since that time they have
sent Youth A to school with shorts under his pants and at times he
3

removes his pants but always keeps his shorts on, Director noted
this was not a sexual issue or concern.
Documents Reviewed:
• Behavior Notification written by Case Manager, dated
3/1/2024, noting the phone contact from school counselor
regarding Youth A masturbating in class.
• Behavior Notification written by Therapist, dated 3/1/2024,
noting the meeting between Therapist and Youth A
regarding him masturbating at school. The information
noted was consistent with Therapist’s interview.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Sufficiency of staff. There
is no evidence that Youth A was being sexually touched or taught
to masturbate by staff or other youth at Wolverine Center.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
